roles.description: Graduated cum laude with a GPA of 3.59. Inducted into the International Honor Society for the Computing and Information Disciplines. Minored in Creative Writing.

I wrote, tested, debugged, formatted, documented, and optimized both front-end and back-end code. I solved problems found in regular scans, ensuring the code adhered to company standards. Additionally, I participated in regular scrum stand-up meetings and code reviews, collaborating with the team to ensure the successful delivery of high-quality, scalable applications.

The App Academy training program by HTD Talent helped me sharpen my full-stack development skills through hands-on solo and group projects. I gained experience in both front-end and back-end development, while collaborating with peers and tackling real-world challenges. The program enhanced my ability to work independently and as part of a team, preparing me for a career in full-stack development.

The Mavericks program hosted by Hexavarsity provided in-depth training in full-stack development, focusing on both individual and group projects. TI developed a strong understanding of the full software development process, solving complex problems. The program refined my technical skills and teamwork abilities, equipping me for success in full-stack development.

I independently designed, developed, deployed, and maintained a website for a non-profit, ensuring it met both functional and aesthetic requirements. Throughout the project, I adhered to best coding practices and accessibility standards, ensuring the website was user-friendly, responsive, and accessible to all users, including those with disabilities.
